com.percussion.publisher.client
Class PSFtpPublisherHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.publisher.client.PSFtpPublisherHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSPublisher
public class PSFtpPublisherHandler
extends Object
implements IPSPublisher

This is the implementation of the IPSPublisher that we ship as part of Rhythmyx Publisher. This plugin publishes the content items or documents to another remote machine (local to the publisher which is a SOAP client) using FTP.

Method Detail

init

public void init(IPSContentPublisherContext publisherContext)
          throws PSPublisherPluginException
Description copied from interface: IPSPublisher
Method called by the engine during initialization. This is called only once in the plugin object's lifetime. Typically used to perform any initialization before publishing.

Note that the publishing plugin is initialized before use, but after IPSPublisher.getDeliveryTypes() is called.

Specified by:
init in interface IPSPublisher
Parameters:
publisherContext - that has variety of information that may be required for plugin's initialization.
Throws:
PSPublisherPluginException

Specified by:
terminate in interface IPSPublisher
Throws:
PSPublisherPluginException

needsContentForUnpublishing

public boolean needsContentForUnpublishing()
Description copied from interface: IPSPublisher
By implementing this method users can tell publisher engine to supply either assembled content or null as InputStream parameter to unpublish method. The unpublish method requires assembled content to unpublish the item in some cases (Database publishing) and not in some other cases (File, FTP). Implementor has to return false if the content is not required while unpublishing and true if it is required.

Specified by:
needsContentForUnpublishing in interface IPSPublisher
Returns:
true or false based on content requirement in unpublishing.

getDeliveryTypes

public Collection getDeliveryTypes()
Get method that returns the delivery type string. This string is used to make sure the registered delivery type (specified in the properties file matches with this.

Specified by:
getDeliveryTypes in interface IPSPublisher
Returns:
Collection with only one string object PSUtils.PLUGIN_FTP, never null or empty.
See Also:
IPSPublisher

publish

public int publish(IPSContentItemContext contentItemContext,
                   InputStream in)
            throws PSPublisherPluginException
This actually does the publishing. This does not throw any not fatal exception in case failure since the error information is not logged anyway. It just returns the action type (one of them is ERROR). Refer to the interface IPSPublisher for action types.

Specified by:
publish in interface IPSPublisher
Parameters:
contentItemContext - the current item context that all the required information for publishing that item. Must not be null.
in - the content to be published or unpublished. Must not be null. Calling class closes the stream.
Returns:
int nAction one of the several possible action status types.
Throws:
PSPublisherPluginException - in case of any fatal error and publish cannot be proceeded for other items too.
IllegalArgumentException - in case if any of the required arguments is null.
See Also:
IPSPublisher

unpublish

public int unpublish(IPSContentItemContext contentItemContext,
                     InputStream in)
              throws PSPublisherPluginException
This actually does the unpublishing. This does not throw any not fatal exception in case failure since the error information is not logged anyway. It just returns the action type (one of them is ERROR). Refer to the interface IPSPublisher for action types.

Specified by:
unpublish in interface IPSPublisher
Parameters:
in - the content to be unpublished. May be null.
contentItemContext - Content Item Context contains item level information useful for unpublishing, never null.
Returns:
int nAction one of the several possible action status types.
Throws:
PSPublisherPluginException - in case of any fatal error and publish cannot be proceeded for other items too.
IllegalArgumentException - in case if any of the required arguments is null.
See Also:
IPSPublisher

logoff

public void logoff()
Quit an active FTP session (take no action if no active session)
